questions.question: What is the background color on a road sign like this?
choices: Red
Yellow
Brown

questions.question: You should use your horn:
choices: When necessary to communicate with other road users
To alert blind pedestrians of your presence
To show other drivers that they made a mistake

questions.question: This road sign tells you that:
choices: The roadway you are on ends ahead
There is a railroad crossing ahead
There is a one-way street ahead

questions.question: What does the marking in the left-hand lane (A) mean?
choices: You should merge left
You can only turn left from this lane
You cannot turn left from this lane

questions.question: The Implied Consent Law means:
choices: You must take special precautions to avoid accidents
You must always carry proper insurance
If requested by an officer, you must submit to a BAC test

questions.question: Before turning left, it is essential to:
choices: Sound your horn
Move to the right-most portion of your lane
Yield to oncoming vehicles

questions.question: This sign is:
choices: An advisory speed sign
A regulatory speed limit sign
A warning of an upcoming speed change

questions.question: A driver who has been drinking alcoholic beverages will usually:
choices: Have slower reaction time
See better at night
Make better decisions

questions.question: You have stopped your car. Before opening your door, you should always:
choices: Adjust your rear-view mirror
Honk your horn
Check behind you to make sure it is safe

questions.question: At a railroad crossing, you must give trains the right-of-way:
choices: Only if a crossing gate is lowered
In all situations
Only if red lights are flashing

questions.question: Before you start driving, you should:
choices: Kick the tires a few times
Properly adjust your seat and mirrors
Adjust the seat to a reclining position

questions.question: Sharing a lane with a motorcyclist:
choices: Is permitted if you keep a distance of three feet or more
Is against the law
Is permitted in business and residential districts

questions.question: At an uncontrolled intersection, a driver should always yield the right-of-way to:
choices: The vehicle that reaches the intersection first
The vehicle that is traveling faster
The vehicle approaching from the left

questions.question: When entering a multi-lane highway, you must:
choices: Give highway traffic the right-of-way
Drive faster than the highway traffic to find a gap
Stop before merging with highway traffic

questions.question: The best way to drive through a sharp curve is:
choices: Slow down before entering the curve
Slow down when you have entered the curve
Not to change your speed

questions.question: If you are involved in a traffic crash, and someone is injured, your first course of action should be:
choices: Get help
Use flares to alert traffic
Move the injured off the roadway

questions.question: You should never stay alongside a large vehicle such as a truck or bus. Why is this?
choices: It is against the law
Large vehicles always have the right-of-way
It is hard for the driver to see you

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a solid red light and a steady DON'T WALK signal is being displayed:
choices: After stopping and yielding, you can make a right turn
You must slow down before entering the intersection
After stopping and yielding, you can make a left turn on any street

questions.question: When driving at higher speeds, which method helps you determine a safe following distance between you and vehicle in front?
choices: Using a three-car-length rule
Using a four-second rule
Flashing your headlights

questions.question: If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights has stopped on the shoulder of a two-lane roadway, you must:
choices: Stop at least 200 feet behind the emergency vehicle
Reduce speed and pass with caution
Move over to the left half of the roadway

questions.question: You can make a right turn in the direction of a red arrow:
choices: Allowed after following the rules that apply to solid red circular lights
Under no circumstances
Only if necessary to avoid danger

questions.question: If the engine shuts off while you are driving:
choices: You must warn others with your horn or headlights
You cannot use the steering wheel or your brakes
You should keep a strong grip on the steering wheel and brake

questions.question: A center lane with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line on both sides:
choices: Is used for making both right and left turns
Is used for making left turns
Is used for emergencies

questions.question: When you plan to exit a multi-lane highway, you should:
choices: Start slowing down in the deceleration lane
Speed up to find a gap in your exit lane
Not use your turn signal until you exit

questions.question: Compared to other highway users, motorcyclists:
choices: Don't have to obey the same traffic laws
Are less affected by bumpy road surfaces
Have the same rights and responsibilities

questions.question: This sign means:
choices: Slow down and keep right since the road curves one way (left)
Two roadways come together, but you are not required to merge
Two roadways come together, slow down and be prepared to merge

questions.question: You cannot park your car:
choices: On a hill
Within 30 feet of a stop sign
25 feet from a fire hydrant

questions.question: When turning left from the lane closest to the center of a street, you should:
choices: Complete the turn in either lane going in your direction
Complete the turn in the right-hand lane of the cross street
Complete the turn in the closest lane going in your direction

questions.question: The minimum speed you may drive on an interstate highway is:
choices: 45 mph
35 mph
30 mph

questions.question: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car at night:
choices: Adjust your instrument lights so they are brighter
Focus on the center line on the road
Look to the edge of the roadway

questions.question: The four-second rule refers to how you should:
choices: Yield at intersections
Follow another vehicle
Drive at night

questions.question: You should fasten your seat belts and make sure all passengers are using seat belts or child restraints:
choices: Only when you are going on a long trip
When a police officer pulls you over
Before you start driving

questions.question: When you stop at a railroad crossing, you must stop:
choices: Within 10 feet
50 feet from the nearest track
No closer than 15 feet

questions.question: When taking any medicine, you should:
choices: Learn about side effects before driving
Keep your window open and drive more slowly
Drink plenty of water before driving

questions.question: What is true about pavement markings on a four-lane divided highway?
choices: Yellow lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction
White lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the opposite direction
White lane lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction

questions.question: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at the same time at a four-way stop, which one should yield?
choices: The vehicle approaching from the left
The vehicle that is traveling faster
The vehicle that is bigger

questions.question: What color is used as background on traffic signs guiding you to driver services?
choices: Blue
Brown
Yellow

questions.question: Trying to beat a truck to a single-lane construction zone is dangerous because:
choices: Trucks will try to block your way
Trucks take longer to stop
Trucks have the right-of-way

questions.question: Where is it illegal to park a vehicle?
choices: 20 feet from a fire hydrant
In front of a public driveway
On a hill

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you turn at an intersection because:
choices: They always have the right-of-way at intersections
It can be difficult to pick the cyclist out of the traffic scene
They don't stop at intersections

questions.question: What can help to reduce glare from oncoming vehicles at night?
choices: Look to the right edge of your lane, away from the glare
Adjust your instrument lights so they are brighter
Turn on your high-beam headlights

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Side Road
Cross Road
Sharp turn

questions.question: When stopped by law enforcement, it is important that you:
choices: Exit your vehicle
Keep your hands in plain view
Keep your windows closed

questions.question: You need more space in front of your vehicle:
choices: When following slow-moving vehicles
When you drive in the right-hand lane
In fog or inclement weather

questions.question: What is an SR-22?
choices: Proof of lawful presence in the United States
Certificate of insurance
An accident report form

questions.question: Compared to stopping on the pavement, what is true about the stopping distance on loose gravel?
choices: There is no difference
It is longer (increased)
It is shorter (decreased)

questions.question: If you have a tire blowout, you should:
choices: Let the car slow to a low speed or a stop
Brake hard to bring your car to an immediate stop
Allow the steering wheel to move freely

questions.question: When a stop line is present at a stop sign, drivers must:
choices: Stop only if pedestrians are in the crosswalk
Stop at the line
Stop where it is possible to see clearly in all directions

questions.question: When sharing the road with a bicyclist:
choices: The bicyclist must give you and other vehicles the right-of-way
You must keep a safe distance between you and the bicyclist
You should always honk your horn to alert the bicyclist

questions.question: This is the shape and color of a:
choices: Stop sign
Wrong way sign
Yield sign

questions.question: Emotions affect your driving. If you feel angry or excited, you should:
choices: Drive 5-10 mph slower than the speed limit
Focus on the reason behind your feelings
Cool off before getting behind the wheel

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at an uncontrolled intersection, which should have the right-of-way?
choices: The driver who arrives last
The driver who is traveling faster
The driver who arrives first

questions.question: You must always stop before railroad tracks if:
choices: There are more than two tracks
You cannot cross and clear the tracks
Train traffic is frequent

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Trucks entering the highway
No standing any time
No trucks

questions.question: If you want to turn at an intersection but end up in a lane marked for through traffic, you must:
choices: Make a wide turn
Continue straight through
Wait until you can change lane safely

questions.question: When is a good time to adjust your seat and mirrors?
choices: When you stop at a red light
After you start driving
Before you start driving

questions.question: To stop in an emergency situation with an antilock braking system, you need to:
choices: Push hard on the brake pedal
Remove pressure from the brake pedal
Pump your brakes to activate ABS

questions.question: What should you do at the first sign of rain or snow?
choices: Drive as closely as possible to the center of the road
Reduce your speed
Turn off your headlights

questions.question: Which statement is true about motorcyclists and other highway users?
choices: Motorcyclists are less affected by wind and rain
Motorcyclists have the right of way in congested traffic
They have the same rights and responsibilities

questions.question: You should not attempt to pass another vehicle:
choices: On roads with center lines
When your view is blocked by a hill
On one-way streets

questions.question: When you accidentally run off the pavement, you can lose control of the vehicle if you:
choices: Use your brakes carefully
Panic steer back onto the pavement
Take your foot off the gas pedal

questions.question: Which of the following vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?
choices: A school bus
A vehicle longer than 40 feet
A motorcycle

questions.question: If you approach a fire emergency site where a fire truck has stopped, it is unlawful to:
choices: Park closer than one block from a fire truck
Drive faster than 25 mph
Turn on your headlights

questions.question: You should enter a roundabout:
choices: After coming to a complete stop and looking both ways
Immediately, as you always have the right-of-way
When there is a big enough gap in traffic

questions.question: This sign tells you:
choices: You must not drive into a street in the direction you are going
Turning left at the intersection is not allowed
Making a U-turn at the intersection is not allowed

questions.question: It is illegal to park a vehicle if a fire hydrant is within:
choices: 25 feet
20 feet
15 feet

questions.question: After passing a large truck, you should:
choices: Cut in directly in front of the truck
Slow down
Not return too soon to your lane

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: School crossing
Cross road
Pedestrian crossing

questions.question: A sign with this shape means:
choices: Warning
Do not enter
Stop
